text:
Well, they do always say the president is underpaid.

Alec Baldwin only pockets $1,400 an episode for his wildly popular impersonation of President-elect Donald Trump on “Saturday Night Live,” according to The New York Times.

It’s a meager salary for an actor of Baldwin’s stature, given his estimated $65 million net worth (according to CelebrityNetWorth.com) and past history of earning $300,000 per show on “30 Rock,” which aired on the same network, NBC.

Full-time “Saturday Night Live” cast members aren’t exactly raking in the big bucks either, however. The average comic on the show likely earns no more than $500,000 for a 21-episode season, Forbes reported in August.

Alec Baldwin only makes $1,400 per episode for his recurring impression of Donald Trump on “SNL.”

But Baldwin keeps coming back. He’s parodied the soon-to-be commander-in-chief in eight of the first 10 episodes on the late-night sketch comedy show’s 42nd season, often churning out the most memorable segment of the week.

And while Baldwin doesn’t write any of his own jokes for his spoofs of Trump, he knows how to put his personal twist on the mockery.

“I see a guy who seems to pause and dig for the more precise and better language he wants to use, and never finds it,” he told The Times of his Trump impression. “It’s the same dish — it’s a grilled-cheese sandwich rhetorically over and over again.”

Trump, meanwhile, doesn’t see the humor in the 58-year-old star’s impression. The President-elect rushed to Twitter to lambaste “SNL,” as well as Baldwin’s parody, multiple times in recent months — then doubled-down in a recent “Today” show interview.

“There’s nothing funny about it,” he told host Matt Lauer. “The skits are terrible. I mean, I like Alec, but his imitation of me is really mean-spirited and not very good.”

“I don’t think his imitation of me gets me at all,” Trump continued. “And it’s meant to be very mean-spirited, which is very biased. I don’t like it. So I can tweet that out.”

Donald Trump has made it clear he’s not a fan of Baldwin’s impression.

Baldwin has fired back at Trump multiple times after the billionaire’s criticisms of the show, recently tweeting, “Release your tax returns and I’ll stop.”

For what it’s worth, the president of the United States takes home $400,000 per year.
title: Guess how much Alec Baldwin makes per episode for his Donald Trump impression on ‘Saturday Night Live’

meta_data.description: Well, they do always say the president is underpaid.
